NOTES: ﻿2 churches stand today, neither built before 1870... There were two churches beforehand: Our Lady of the Assumption in 1838 and St. Lawrence in 1850. attendingChurch: ﻿occasionally visited from the city of Charleston

instNote: ﻿Mass on Sundays during every second month

NOTES: ﻿While this church would not be built until 1840, the historical research others have done appears to make a clear connection between this early group of Catholics in 1833 and the formation of a congregation, then a church, in a few years. Because it is a precursor, I feel like it is worth giving it the ID: https://newbernhistorical.org/this-month-in-new-bern-history-january-2022/

instName: ﻿Church of St. Philip and St. James

courses: ﻿French and English Languages, Sacred and Profane History, Ancient and Modern Geography, Mythology, and all the various kinds of Fancy and Ornamental Needie Work.
